comment: This professor has high standards for her students and expects you to submit thorough and accurate work. The software architecture book used for the course was OK; a more modern book would have been better IMO.

Group projects are decent and not too annoying, but tests/quizzes (labeled as quizzes but are actually tests) are terrible. All are cumulative, and there is far too much subject material to memorize in preparation for them, and she gives no guidance on what to expect or prepare for. Wildly inconsistent amount of questions per quiz.

I've had this professor for three classes now. Her lectures are just mountains of slides with no clear emphasis put on anything. Your tests will amount to trying to memorize everything you possibly can since you never know what will show up. Her slides and exams are filled with spelling and grammatical errors.
Avoid this professor at all costs.  Brutal Tests.  Harsh Grading for no reason.  Test and project scores don't reflect work or knowledge.  No amount of study or work will improve your grade.

SWE 6653 Even if you buy the book and read it, her exams will still confuse you by what she chooses to ask and the wording she uses. I've been waiting for weeks to receive a grade/feedback on my first group project deliverable. If you fail one of the assignments or one of the exams, you are pretty much done for. Avoid this professor if possible.

Gives unclear instructions on how to complete assignments but then harshly grades. If you email her to ask questions or clarity she will respond, but the response will be vague and not actually helpful. Doesn't actually provide lectures just posts a lot of youtube videos and wikipedia links.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader
